intro: Psychotria tubuaiensis, commonly known as the Tubaui psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the island of Tubaui in the French territory of Saint Barthélemy. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in coastal or forested areas. Due to its limited geographic range, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
